it.polimi.se2019.server.model.player

Class PlayerBoard

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polimi.se2019.server.model.player.PlayerBoard
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class PlayerBoard
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    The Playerboard class contains all the information regarding the real playerboard counterpart. It stores the number of damages the player accumulated as well the number of marks, point-death, cubes and deaths.
    Author:
    mattiamassarini,merklind,thisisferra
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • PlayerBoard

        public PlayerBoard(Player owner)
        Set the ammoCubes to 1 red, 1 yellow and 1 blue at the start of the game
        Parameters:

    • Method Detail

      • resumePlayerBoard

        public static PlayerBoard resumePlayerBoard(org.json.simple.JSONObject playerBoardToResume,
                                            Match resumedMatch)
        It restores the playerboard back to its original state.
        Parameters:
        playerBoardToResume - JSONObject object containing the information needed to restore the object.
        resumedMatch - Match object used to search and link the players to their playerboards.
        Returns:
        the playerboard restored.

      • setPointDeaths

        private void setPointDeaths()
        It fills the pointDeath arrayList with the starting game points. Each element represent the number of points a player gets for killing another one. The order is based on the number of damage dealt by each player.

      • setFinalFrenzyPointDeaths

        public void setFinalFrenzyPointDeaths()
        It refills the pointDeath arrayList with the final frenzy game points. Each element represent the number of points a player gets for killing another one. The order is based on the number of damage dealt by each player.

      • getDamage

        public java.util.ArrayList<Player> getDamage()
        Getter method returning the Player collection.
        Returns:
        the number of damages each player dealt in chronologically order.

      • getDeaths

        public int getDeaths()
        Getter method returning how many times the player died during the game.
        Returns:
        the number of deaths.

      • setDeaths

        public void setDeaths()
        It adds one death to the deaths field. It cannot exceeds 5 deaths.

      • resetDeaths

        public void resetDeaths()
        Set the number of deaths to 0.

      • getEnemyDamages

        public java.util.ArrayList<EnemyDamage> getEnemyDamages()
        Getter method of the enemyDamages collection.
        Returns:
        the collection of EnemyDamages.

      • getPointDeaths

        Getter method of the pointDeaths collection.
        Returns:
        pointDeaths collection.

      • getAmmoCubes

        public Cubes getAmmoCubes()
        Returns:
        the number of cubes the player has.

        public java.util.ArrayList<EnemyMark> getEnemyMarks()
        Returns:
        the enemyMarks collection.

      • setAmmoCubes

        public void setAmmoCubes(Cubes currentCubes)
        It adds cubes to the current ammoCubes. They cannot exceeds 3 cubes for each color.
        Parameters:
        currentCubes - the number of cubes to be added.

      • setDeltaAmmoCubes

        public void setDeltaAmmoCubes(Cubes currentCubes)
        It sets the number of cubes to currentCubes.
        Parameters:
        currentCubes - the number of cubes to be set.

      • deleteFirstPointDeaths

        public void deleteFirstPointDeaths()
        It removes the first element of the firstPointDeaths list, whenever the player die.

      • sortAggressor

        public void sortAggressor()
        It sort the enemyDamages list from the highest damage to the lowest.

      • dealDamage

        public void dealDamage(Player attacker,
                       int damage)
        It deals damage to the current player. If the damage collection is empty, the attacker gains one point. If the current player has marks of the attacker player, the method marksToDamages will be called and additional damage is applied. If the damage exceeds certain thresholds, it triggers adrenaline actions.
        Parameters:
        attacker - the reference of the player who's attacking.
        damage - the damage dealt.

      • marksToDamage

        private int marksToDamage(Player attacker)
        check if the attacker has marks on his target, if so it returns the number of marks accumulated and erase that element from the enemyMarks list.

      • dealMark

        public void dealMark(Player aggressor,
                     int marks)
        apply a number of marks, if it's the first time the aggressor deals marks a new EnemyMark object is created.

      • clearDamage

        public void clearDamage()

      • payCubes

        public void payCubes(Cubes cubesToPay)
        Subtract the current cubes stack from the cubes
        Parameters:
        cubesToPay - cubes to be paid.

      • toJSON

        public org.json.simple.JSONObject toJSON()
        It save the current state on a JSONObject object.
        Returns:
        the JSONObject containing the information of the original Cubes object.
